about_the_game:
Okinawa Journal is a captivating point-and-click visual novel game set during the summer of 2000 in the serene yet mysterious landscapes of Okinawa. You step into the ethereal role of Kami, a guardian angel tasked with guiding Haruki, a struggling journalist, as he delves into the baffling disappearance of a beloved actress.

The Okinawa Journal demo showcases a small selection of scenes from the full game. This consists of five fully playable locations with interactable objects, characters, spirits, as well as a map and inventory. Just as in the main game, the demo starts off in Haruki's office at the Okinawa Journal headquarters.

As you interact with objects and characters, locations, options, and choices will be revealed.

You’ll meet a diverse cast of characters—both human and spirit—each harboring their own secrets, ambitions, and obligations. As the demo unfolds, you’ll uncover a web of hidden truths tied to Okinawa’s dark past, with consequences that linger in the present.

With challenging decisions, five intriguing locations to explore, the Okinawa Journal demo invites you to start shaping a story where eventually, every choice carries weight.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-4440 or equivalent
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 1050 / AMD Radeon RX 480
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-97850H @ 2.60 GHz or AMD equivalent
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660 Ti or higher with 6GB Memory
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 MB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible

short_description: A guardian angel watches over a struggling journalist, guiding him as he takes on the mysterious case of a missing actress. But as his investigation deepens, he uncovers a harrowing centuries-old curse that threatens not only the actress but his wife, child, and the very future of his bloodline.
